item.title: SIS Programmer Analyst (University of California Merced)
item.description:
The University of California, Merced is the newest and tenth campus of the University of California system and the first American research university built in the 21st century. With more than 2,700 students, UC Merced has planned for additional student growth until we reach an enrollment of approximately 25,000 students. With undergraduate, graduate, and PhD programs, plans for a future medical school program, partnerships and community involvement, the UC Merced campus is continually evolving, requiring talented, knowledgeable and dynamic educators, researchers, management and staff.

As a member of the Information Technology department, the SIS Programmer Analyst will participate in the analysis, design, development, implementation, maintenance and support of mission-critical, multi-tier business applications in an Oracle RDBMS environment. This position will be responsible for development and maintenance of UC Merceds SunGardHE, Banner Student Information System, and associated applications, and be involved in other large academic and administrative systems as needed. The SIS Programmer Analyst will program primarily in SQL, PL/SQL, and Java in an Oracle/Unix environment, but will also be expected to learn and become productive in other languages and technologies as needed. Success in this position will require superb analytical and technical skills, excellent communication and team work skills, as well as the ability to successfully deliver on a wide variety of technical challenges and tasks.

Minimum Qualifications:
Bachelors degree or equivalent combination of education and experience.

Experience in the analysis, design, development, implementation, maintenance and support of mission-critical, multi-tier business applications in an Oracle RDBMS environment.

Experience analyzing business processes, interviewing functional experts to understand business requirements, and documenting functional and technical specifications. Experience in application design, data modeling, and process modeling.

Experience with Oracle RDBMS application development, including development of tables, indexes, packages, procedures, triggers, views and other database objects. Knowledge of and experience in SQL, PL/SQL, and Oracle Forms development, and other Oracle tools and technologies.

Experience programming in 3GL languages, especially Java. Knowledge of UNIX and experience with UNIX shell scripting.

Experience with the SungardHE Banner Student Information System is highly desired.

Experience supporting 24x7 mission-critical applications, as well as large complex applications and database repositories, is required.

The successful candidate must have not only high level technology competencies, but also excellent customer relationship skills. This person needs to be personally invested in providing the best level of service to customers both inside and outside the department. Being open, collaborative, a good communicator, and service-oriented as well as a strong team contributor are critical success factors.

To view full job description and to apply online please visit us at www.ucmerced.edu/jobs
